You have two options.

1. The Javadoc. Here is the Javadoc for the MirrorWr=
iterProcessor in Heritrix 3.1.1: http://builds.archive.org:8080/javadoc/her=
itrix-3.1.1/org/archive/modules/writer/MirrorWriterProcessor.html

If you a=
re using another version of Heritrix, you may want to hunt down the appropr=
iate version Javadoc. Unfortunately, whoever wrote this processor didn't bo=
ther with documenting the public methods, so you'll only get the property n=
ames (e.g. there is a setMaxPathLength() meaning that you can set the prope=
rty maxPathLength in the CXML).

2. View the source. For Heritrix 3.1.1 you=
 can find the source of MirrorWriterProcessor here: https://github.com/inte=
rnetarchive/heritrix3/blob/3.1.1/modules/src/main/java/org/archive/modules/=
writer/MirrorWriterProcessor.java

Viewing the source I found that default =
access member variables are actually documented (even if the public getter/=
setter method are not) and thus this provides much more useful information.=



It is illogical to document the modules in this manner but unfortunately=
 this is the way it is. There really needs to be an effort to change this s=
o that the Javadoc captures this information.

- Kris

 [archive-crawler] MirrorWritterProcessor - Setting up different properties=




Hi All,

I am trying to use MirrorWritterProcessor as warcWriter. and I=
 want to know what are the different types of properties I can set to this =
writer. it would be great if someone can point me to some document about mi=
rrorwriterprocessor with cxml configuration.

Thank You
